snippet: Viewers who watch prime-time television days later are becoming an essential factor in determining a show’s popularity.
abstract: Daily television program ratings are sure to change once the people who time-shift their viewing are taken into account; time-shifters cannot be counted in the overnight ratings, which still set the tone and the agenda at the networks; what will matter most when the season ends, for both networks and advertisers, is the ranking of shows once digital video recorder playback is included in viewership totals.

byline.original: By BILL CARTER and BRIAN STELTER

lead_paragraph: Viewers who watch prime-time television days later are becoming an essential factor in determining a show’s popularity.

headline.main: DVRs and Streaming Prompt a Shift in the Top-Rated TV Shows
headline.print_headline: DVRs and Streaming Prompt a Shift in the Top-Rated TV Shows
